data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you face forward, all the steps are forward. When you face backward you are sideways. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point should be straight. Turning right can be done after turn right. So, the answer is No.

There are 2 ways to take steps forward. In the first method, keep your face forward and keep a straight line. In the second method, take a right move towards the starting point and back. In the third method, take a left move towards the ending place and return. So, the answer is (No).

If you keep facing forward in the forward direction, you will begin to forward. For every step forward that you take, you will also be facing forward for that step. If you take 7 steps left, you take 2 steps right. If you take 5 steps backward, you take 5 steps backward. For every step forward that you take, you will also be facing forward for that step. If you take 7 steps out. you will be facing left, and for each step forward that you take, you are facing right. If you take 7 steps left, you will be facing right. If you take 7 steps for a right step, you will be facing left. If you take 7 steps forward, you will be facing right. Therefore, the answer is No.
